revised_title: A Description of Stone-Eating Worms and Their Unique Characteristics
tldr: The author describes a type of worm that can eat through stone, providing detailed observations of their anatomy, behavior, and habitat. These worms are found in ancient walls and structures, where they create cavities by consuming stone and leaving behind excrement and stone dust. The author also mentions the presence of similar creatures that eat mortar and discusses the possibility of these organisms taking wing and resembling caterpillars.
